info.title: openconfig-access-points
info.description:
This module defines the top level WiFi Configurations for a list of
    Access Points.

**Module:** `openconfig-access-points`
**Paths:** 5

get.description:
Top most container for configuration and state data for Access
        Points.

put.description:
Create or replace Top most container for configuration and state data for Access
        Points.

patch.description:
Partially modify Top most container for configuration and state data for Access
        Points.

delete.description:
Delete Top most container for configuration and state data for Access
        Points.

get.description:
Configuration and state data for the access point referenced in the
          list entry. (collection)

post.description:
Add a new entry to Configuration and state data for the access point referenced in the
          list entry. (collection)

get.description:
Configuration and state data for the access point referenced in the
          list entry.

put.description:
Create or replace Configuration and state data for the access point referenced in the
          list entry.

patch.description:
Partially modify Configuration and state data for the access point referenced in the
          list entry.

delete.description:
Delete Configuration and state data for the access point referenced in the
          list entry.

get.description:
Configuration and state data for the access point referenced in the
          list entry. (collection)

post.description:
Add a new entry to Configuration and state data for the access point referenced in the
          list entry. (collection)

get.description:
Configuration and state data for the access point referenced in the
          list entry.

put.description:
Create or replace Configuration and state data for the access point referenced in the
          list entry.

patch.description:
Partially modify Configuration and state data for the access point referenced in the
          list entry.

delete.description:
Delete Configuration and state data for the access point referenced in the
          list entry.

id.description:
id serves as a reference point to the [1-n] manager(s) this AP
            is assigned to.

fqdn.description:
The FQDN of a manager this AP is assigned to. The list should be
        ordered, according to priority. eg Primary first,
        Secondary second, Tertiary third etc.

ap-manager-ipv4-address.description:
IPv4 address of a manager for this AP. The list should be
        ordered, according to priority. eg. Primary first, Secondary second,
        Tertiary third etc.

ap-manager-ipv6-address.description:
IPv6 address of a manager for this AP. The list should be
        ordered, according to priority. eg. Primary first, Secondary second,
        Tertiary third etc.

joined.description:
True only if this AP is currently joined to a manager. If this AP
        is configured to join manager(s), however is not currently joined
        to any manager, this MUST return False.

id.description:
id serves as a reference point to the [1-n] manager(s) this AP
            is assigned to.

fqdn.description:

        ordered, according to priority. eg Primary first,
        Secondary second, Tertiary third etc.

        is configured to join manager(s), however is not currently joined
        to any manager, this MUST return False.

config.description: Config. container for assigning APs to managers.

tags.name: openconfig-access-points

This module defines the top level WiFi Configurations for a list of
    Access Points.
